title: Induced current - cart leaving a field

content.question: A conductive loop is attached to a cart that moves with a constant velocity <math alttext="v sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> through a region of constant magnetic field <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> directed out of the page, as shown. What is the direction of the current in the loop as the cart exits the field, and why?

choices.label: Clockwise, because the flux through the loop is decreasing, inducing a current in the loop that produces a magnetic field out of the page.
Clockwise, because the flux through the loop is increasing, inducing a current in the loop that produces a magnetic field into the page.
Counterclockwise, because the flux through the loop is decreasing, inducing a current in the loop that produces a magnetic field out of the page.
Counterclockwise, because the flux through the loop is increasing, inducing a current in the loop that produces a magnetic field into the page.

content.answer: Counterclockwise, because the flux through the loop is decreasing, inducing a current in the loop that produces a magnetic field out of the page.
